title: Astrobotic lunar lander on track for late 2022 launch
summary: Astrobotic Technology showed off its nearly complete lunar lander it is building for NASA’s Commercial Lunar Payload Services (CLPS) program and said the spacecraft remains on schedule to launch this year.

title: South Korea’s double-digit space budget boost
summary: South Korea is boosting its space spending this year by 19% over 2021 levels as it seeks to bounce back from October’s failed attempt to prove it can put up a satellite without Russian rocket hardware.

title: NASA selects six companies to demonstrate commercial successors to TDRS
summary: Six companies, including both traditional satellite operators and constellation developers, have won NASA awards to demonstrate services that could ultimately replace the agency’s existing fleet of communications satellites.

title: DoD a main proponent of anti-satellite test ban: ‘We are not disarming’
summary: "Space related rules and norms of responsible behavior are in our interest,” said deputy assistant secretary of defense John Hill

title: OneWeb signs contract to launch satellites from India in 2022
summary: OneWeb has signed a contract to use India’s largest launch vehicle to deploy at least some of its remaining LEO broadband satellites this year, according to a company executive.
